Suffolk Libraries

Home → Events and activities → Get online

Get online

All Suffolk Libraries offer free internet access and informal advice on getting online.

If you have a library card number and a PIN you can book a computer online.

Some libraries offer free one to one computer and internet training: <table class="pure-table">

Location Activity Day and time Aldeburgh Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sundays 1300-1400, 1400-1500 Beccles Library Tablet and eReader training sessions for beginners: book in advance Alternate Tuesdays 0900-1000 Internet and email training sessions for beginners: book in advance (4 week course) Thursdays 0900-1030 Absolute Beginners: book in advance (4 week course) Wednesdays 0900-1030 Family history sessions: book in advance Thursdays 1100-1200 Broomhill Library (formerly Westbourne Library)Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance
  • Tuesdays 1030-1130, 1145-1245
  • Alternate Fridays 1000-1100, 1100-1200
Bungay Library Internet, tablet and Ancestry training sessions for beginners: book in advance first Wednesday of the month 1000-1300 Internet, tablet and Ancestry training sessions for beginners: book in advance Thursdays 1000-1200 Internet, tablet and Ancestry training sessions for beginners: book in advance Fridays 1000-1200 Capel St Mary Library Computer and tablet training sessions for beginners drop-in: bring in your own device Tuesdays 1000-1200 Felixstowe Library Absolute Beginners 1:1 Saturdays 1400-1445 Digital drop-in Thursday 1600-1700 Gainsborough Library Absolute Beginners: book in advance Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis Internet training sessions for beginners: drop-in Monday every two weeks 1030-1200 Great Cornard Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance
  • Thursdays 1700-1800
  • Saturdays 1300-1400
Halesworth Library Laptop training sessions for beginners: book in advance (£5 per session) Wednesdays 1400-1500 iPad training sessions for beginners: book in advance (£5 per session) Wednesdays 1515-1615 Haverhill Library 1:1 IT tutorials on PC or tablets: £4 for half an hour, £7.50 for up to an hour Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis Ipswich County Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance
  • Fridays 1500-1530, 1530-1600
  • Sundays 1400-1430, 1430-1500
Kedington Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis Lowestoft Library Absolute Beginners: book in advance Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis Needham Market Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sundays 1300-1400 Oulton Broad Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sundays 1100-1600 Rosehill Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sundays 1300-1400 Southwold Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sundays 1300-1530 Stowmarket Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis Sudbury Library 1-to-1 computer taster sessions: book in advance Wednesdays 0930-1030, 1045-1145 Wickham Market Library Free IT support, guidance on the internet and troubleshooting hardware and software issues: book in advance Fridays 1000-1400 Woodbridge Library Free 1-to-1 computer, laptop, tablet and smartphone help: book in advance Mondays and Thursdays 1000-1200
